alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:22AM EST until December 19 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Androscoggin and Oxford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River at Rumford. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.6 feet, This is a 100 year flood. In Mexico, flooding occurs on Riverside Avenue, Dix Avenue, Holman Avenue, Osgood Avenue, Carlton Avenue, and Flood Street. In Rumford, flooding occurs on Propect Avenue, Eaton Hill Road, Front Street, and Sunnyside Terrace. Hundreds of acres of farm fields also flood. Flooding is expected to continue downstream into Dixfield and Jay. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Tuesday was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 8.1 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.2 feet on 04/01/1987. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
